Instead of translating the text of the software into a foreign language, as in the process of localization, the textual elements of an application are replaced with an altered version of the original language. For example, instead of \"Account Settings\", the text may be altered to display as \"!!! Àççôûñţ Šéţţîñĝš !!!\". This setting enables this in Studio as part of the player emulator.","source":"Pseudolocalize","values":{"en-us":"Pseudolocalize"}},{"key":"Studio.PlayerEmulator.MainSwitchSection.LabelText","source":"Enable Test Profile","values":{"en-us":"Enable Test Profile"}}]
